description: A Romano-British settlement dating from the 1st to 4th CE, on the site of a prior Iron Age settlement. A square structure was built around a Bronze Age barrow which has been interpreted as a shrine.
bibliography: Martyn, Blick, Brindle, and et al. “Slonk Hill, Shoreham (West Sussex).” The Rural Settlement of Roman Britain: an online resource, 2015. https://doi.org/10.5284/1030449.
Rudling, David. “Roman-Period Temples, Shrines and Religion in Sussex.” In Ritual Landscapes of Roman South-East Britain, edited by David Rudling, 2008.
